meanings.definition: To fertilize (a plant) by transferring pollen.
meanings.sent1: The bee pollinates the flowers by carrying pollen from one to another.
meanings.sent2: The wind pollinates the plants by blowing pollen from one flower to the next.
meanings.sent3: The butterfly thought it could pollinate the trees by sprinkling glitter on them.
meanings.sent4: The hummingbird's wings seemed to pollinate the garden as it flitted from flower to flower.
meanings.sent5: The farmer used a tiny brush to carefully pollinate each fruit tree in the orchard.

meanings.definition: To transfer pollen from one flower to another for fertilization.
meanings.sent1: The bee pollinates the apple blossoms by moving pollen from one to another.
meanings.sent2: The bee pollinates the garden by spreading pollen from one flower to the next.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to pollinate the flowers by tossing acorns at them.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to pollinate the meadow as it carried pollen from one flower to another.
meanings.sent5: The child pretended to pollinate the daisies by blowing on them like a gentle breeze.
